poem:
Title: "Red Odyssey: Father, Daughter and a Flickering Film"

Van like a heart across Caucasian veined roads,
Crammed with silences, shattered landscapes exposed.
Monumental in dispiritedness they ride,
Kinship, like celluloid, stretched wide.
"Offer a plan," demands the daughter, 
Lest they falter on Khabarovsk's alter.
With chicken whispers in the back,
On the sad edge of a cinematic track.
